alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Rockingham, central Hillsborough and southeastern Merrimack Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hancock to near Weare to near Hooksett. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manchester, Concord, Derry, Merrimack, Henniker, Bedford, Milford, Hooksett, Amherst, Litchfield, Peterborough, Hopkinton, New Boston, Epsom, Antrim, Mont Vernon, Greenfield, Lyndeborough, Francestown and Bennington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 293 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 89 between mile markers 0 and 2, and near mile marker 5. Interstate 93 between mile markers 13 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hillsborough; Interior Rockingham; Merrimack; Western And Central Hillsborough
